Being Italian , I get sad and a bit angry every time I see images of what you call "pizza"

Pls, just pls, you don't have to put everything you can imagine on a pizza. The simpler your pizza is, the better it tastes. 

Also, a small tip: don't put on pizza cheeses that becomes gummy and not stringy when baked, that's why cheddar, gouda or similar isn't exactly the best tipe of cheese to put on pizza. At least, not put it as basis for the pizza, you can add it anyway if you like the taste in addition to stringy cheese, but do it in a way to avoid a gummy consistency in the end
pizza means anything thrown on that dough. it was invented in lack of food a few centuries ago, who cares what you put on it

Pizza dough is different from focaccia dough and can be diffrent from bread dough. You get an entirely different flavour by dough alone, because it changes the property of your pizza. 
Like, focaccia can absorb more oil than the pizza dough, so they must be cooked differently

Pizza is not only WHAT you put on the dough...it is HOW you make the dough, WHAT do you put on it and HOW you bake it
You have the freedom of putting what you want on pizza dough, that is true, but not all the combo work the same, because, whatever you put it, you should get certain results as far as consistency go as long as you go with a certain dough (and in various part of Italy theire are different dough, some dough are more pizza-like dough, others are more like bread-dough, others are more-like focaccia dough and this changes the taste)
Pizza is good indeed.
